references.reason: This paper introduces a distribution-free method for predictive inference in regression, providing a foundation for algorithm-agnostic inference.

references.paper_title: A general framework for inference on algorithm-agnostic variable importance
references.reason: This paper introduces a general framework for inference on algorithm-agnostic variable importance, addressing the degeneracy issue and offering a solution for reliable statistical inference.

references.paper_title: Bootstrapping and sample splitting for high-dimensional, assumption-lean inference
references.reason: This paper presents bootstrapping and sample splitting methods for high-dimensional inference, which are crucial for algorithm-agnostic methods to avoid the degeneracy issue.

references.paper_title: Double/debiased machine learning for treatment and structural parameters
references.reason: This paper introduces double machine learning, a debiased machine learning technique, which is used to address the bias in many algorithm-agnostic methods.
This paper introduces a decorrelated variable importance measure that addresses the degeneracy problem, providing another solution that improves power in algorithm-agnostic inference.
